reviews.review: Frozentastic just as good as the first. Film score was terrific and no one knows how to animate better than Disney. Storyline was captivating and immersive. This is a must see if your little ones like Frozen or even if you like it. My 2 year old sat through the whole thing it was so good.

It was such a great movie! The first one was about the sisters creating their bond, I felt. But frozen 2 was more like them solidifying it for good. I loved the music, and it made me laugh so hard. I would definitely see it again!!
Absolutely amazing script and amazing music !!!!
I WANNA GO BACK AND SEE IT AGAIN !!!!!!
It was incredible! Loved it more than the first one and honestly me and my friends (we are in our 20s or 30s) loved it probably more than the kids.
Must see! Every bit as good as the first.
It is a great movie, great animation, great song very emotional story. It is a worthy follow up to the first and I highly recommend it
Nice songs, storyline, epic graphic and costume design! A total upgraded from the first movie! Love it so much! Into the unknow~~~~

I cannot deny that this movie has amazing music and a great story. I had chills during almost every song because of the power each one held. Where this film fell short for me was the lack of dynamic between characters. All the characters had an amazing dynamic between each other in the beginning, but eventually, the characters get split up and you lose out on a lot of that. the film made me long to see the characters in the wagon again. Normally, I hate the travel parts of films and would prefer the characters to just show up at their destination, but I liked it in this case. A miniature battle between Elsa and the water was brilliant artistically and was a travel sequence because she made it through the sea by the end. However, it didn't last long and the only other travel sequences were Olaf and Anna in a boat which was boring and insignificant and all of the characters in the wagon which held lots of growth for all the characters. The wagon sequence lasted maybe two minutes which may have been the only character dynamic between all the characters. In turn, there is just a huge lack of character dynamic throughout the whole film. All characters by the end go through a change physically or understanding themselves more, but when you have four main characters I would like to see them work off of each other.
This movie was better than the first one, if that's even possible!
